sections.heading: Federal Economic Opportunity Act of 1964; State Board of Education, Compliance; Acceptance and Expenditure of Federal Funds
sections.text:
***** 395.201 THIS SECTION IS NOT EFFECTIVE AFTER JULY 1, 1967: See 395.203 *****

The state board of education may take any necessary action consistent with state law to comply with the provisions of Public Law 452 of the 88th Congress, known as the "economic opportunity act of 1964" and may accept and expend federal funds available under this law.

History:1965, Act 34, Imd. Eff. May 19, 1965 ;-- Am. 1966, Act 111, Imd. Eff. June 22, 1966

sections.heading: Construction of Act as to Expenditure of State Funds; Accounting.
sections.text:
***** 395.202 THIS SECTION IS NOT EFFECTIVE AFTER JULY 1, 1967: See 395.203 *****

This act shall not be construed as authorization to expend nor to incur any obligation to expend any state funds in excess of any amount which may be appropriated for such purpose by the legislature. Any funds appropriated shall be paid out of the state treasury in accordance with state accounting procedures necessary to assure proper distribution of and accounting for federal funds paid to the state.

History:1965, Act 34, Imd. Eff. May 19, 1965

sections.heading: Act Effective Until July 1, 1967.
sections.text:
***** 395.203 THIS SECTION IS NOT EFFECTIVE AFTER JULY 1, 1967: See 395.203 *****

This act shall remain in effect until July 1, 1967.

History:1965, Act 34, Imd. Eff. May 19, 1965 ;-- Am. 1966, Act 111, Imd. Eff. June 22, 1966
